greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1)=1; thereafter, if n is k-th number whose greatest prime factor has an odd index [i.e., n = A244991(k)], a(n) = A026424(a(k)), otherwise, when n is k-th number whose greatest prime factor has an even index [i.e., n = A244990(1+k)], a(n) = A028260(1+a(k)).
comment: This shares with the permutation A122111 the property that each term of A244990 is mapped to a unique term of A028260 and each term of A244991 is mapped to a unique term of A026424.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 27 2014
